verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489> answered, <WH6030>
"If one ventures <WH5254> a word <WH1697> with you, will you become <WH3811> impatient <WH3811>? But who <WH4310> can <WH3201> refrain <WH6113> from speaking <WH4405>?
"Behold <WH2009> you have admonished <WH3256> many, <WH7227> And you have strengthened <WH2388> weak <WH7504> hands. <WH3027>
"Your words <WH4405> have helped the tottering <WH3782> to stand, <WH6965> And you have strengthened <WH553> feeble <WH3766> knees. <WH1290>
"But now <WH6258> it has come <WH935> to you, and you are impatient; <WH3811> It touches <WH5060> you, and you are dismayed. <WH926>
"Is not your fear <WH3374> [of God] your confidence, <WH3690> And the integrity <WH8537> of your ways <WH1870> your hope <WH8615>?
"Remember <WH2142> now, <WH4994> who <WH4310> [ever] perished being innocent <WH6>? Or where <WH9345> were the upright <WH375> destroyed <WH3477>?
"According to what <WH834> I have seen, <WH7200> those who plow <WH9177> iniquity <WH205> And those who sow <WH2232> trouble <WH5999> harvest <WH7114> it.
"By the breath <WH5397> of God <WH433> they perish, And by the blast <WH6> of His anger <WH7307> they come <WH639> to an end. <WH3615>
"The roaring <WH7581> of the lion <WH9030> and the voice <WH6963> of the [fierce] lion, <WH7826> And the teeth <WH8127> of the young <WH3715> lions <WH3715> are broken. <WH5421>
"The lion <WH3918> perishes for lack <WH6> of prey, <WH1097> And the whelps <WH2964> of the lioness <WH1121> are scattered. <WH3833>
"Now a word <WH1697> was brought <WH1589> to me stealthily, <WH1589> And my ear <WH241> received <WH3947> a whisper <WH8102> of it.
"Amid disquieting <WH9620> thoughts <WH9620> from the visions <WH2384> of the night, <WH3915> When deep <WH8639> sleep <WH8639> falls <WH5307> on men, <WH376>
Dread <WH6343> came <WH7122> upon me, and trembling, <WH9564> And made all <WH7230> my bones <WH6106> shake. <WH6342>
"Then a spirit <WH7307> passed <WH2498> by my face; <WH6440> The hair <WH8185> of my flesh <WH1320> bristled <WH5568> up.

"It stood <WH5975> still, <WH5975> but I could not discern <WH5234> its appearance; <WH4758> A form <WH8544> [was] before <WH5048> my eyes; <WH5869> [There was] silence, <WH1827> then I heard <WH8085> a voice: <WH6963>
'Can mankind <WH582> be just <WH6663> before <WH4480> God <WH433>? Can a man <WH1397> be pure <WH2891> before <WH4480> his Maker <WH6213>?
'He puts <WH539> no <WH3808> trust <WH539> even <WH2005> in His servants; <WH5650> And against His angels <WH4397> He charges <WH7760> error. <WH8417>

'How <WH637> much <WH637> more <WH637> those who dwell <WH7931> in houses <WH1004> of clay, <WH2563> Whose <WH834> foundation <WH3247> is in the dust, <WH6083> Who are crushed <WH1792> before <WH6440> the moth! <WH6211>
'Between <WH4480> morning <WH1242> and evening <WH6153> they are broken <WH3807> in pieces; <WH3807> Unobserved, <WH1097> <WH7760> they perish forever. <WH6>
'Is not their tent-cord plucked <WH5265> up within them? They die, <WH4191> yet without <WH3808> wisdom. <WH2451>'
